meeting_annotations.transcript: Hi everyone. Uh, so my name is uh Mathieu, you can call me Matthew or Matt. Um, and uh I'm an assistant professor in geological sciences at Stanford University. Uh, my work is in planetary geology and more specifically on geomorphic and sedimentary processes that shape the landscapes of the solar system and um by studying the mechanics of these processes, uh, my goal is to decipher landscapes and rocks for what they can reveal about paleo environments, hydrology, climate, habitability. And perhaps most relevant um to this workshop, I'm particularly interested in how life may affect these processes and in turn how to infer presence of life from the records of surface processes in rocks.

Um, and with particular interest in how interior processes and interior evolution affect um the surface environment through volatile cycling, um, and you know, uh tectonics affects uh whether a planet can be habitable.
